greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of 1/(1-x+2*x^2-x^3) in powers of x.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,-2,1).
formula: a(n) = a(n-1) - 2*a(n-2) + a(n-3) for all n in Z. - _Michael Somos_, Dec 13 2013
maple: seq(coeff(series(1/(1-x+2*x^2-x^3), x, n+1), x, n), n = 0..50); # _G. C. Greubel_, Aug 07 2019
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 0, SeriesCoefficient[ x^3 / (1 - 2 x + x^2 - x^3), {x, 0, -n}], SeriesCoefficient[ 1 / (1 - x + 2 x^2 - x^3), {x, 0, n}]]
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<0,  polcoeff( x^3 / (1 - 2*x + x^2 - x^3) + x * O(x^-n), -n), polcoeff( 1 / (1 - x + 2*x^2 - x^3) + x * O(x^n), n))} /* _Michael Somos_, Sep 18 2012 */
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 17 2002
